Package ePortfolio

Class Investment

java.lang.Object
ePortfolio.Investment
Direct Known Subclasses:
MutualFund, Stock
public abstract class Investment extends Object
An abstract common parent class for all type of investments (stocks, funds)

  • Field Details

    • bookValue

      protected double bookValue
      Market value of the investment.

  • Constructor Details

    • Investment

      public Investment(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price)
      Initialize an investment. The book value will be automatically calculated based on price and quantity and no commissions involved.
      Parameters:
      symbol - A ticker code that uniquely identifies the investment
      name - Registered name of the investment in the exchange
      quantity - Quantity purchased by a shareholder
      price - Price spent by the shareholder to purchase this number of shares
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If any of the fields are in violation

    • Investment

      public Investment(String symbol, String name, int quantity, double price, double bookValue)
      Initialize an investment. The book value will be automatically calculated based on price and quantity and no commissions involved.
      Parameters:
      symbol - A ticker code that uniquely identifies the investment
      name - Registered name of the investment in the exchange
      quantity - Quantity purchased by a shareholder
      price - Price spent by the shareholder to purchase this number of shares
      bookValue - Market value of the investment.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If any of the fields are in violation

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(int additionalQuantity)
      Purchase additional number of shares using the stored price. Book value will be adjusted accordingly.
      Parameters:
      additionalQuantity - Additional quantity to purchase
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If quantity is invalid.

    • reduce

      public double reduce(int reduceQuantity)
      Reduce the number of shares. The shares will be sold back to the fund manager in exchange of cash based on current prices.
      Parameters:
      reduceQuantity - Number of shares to dispose
      Returns:
      Total amount converted to cash
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the quantity is invalid or the number of shares available is not enough

    • computeUnrealizedGainOrLoss

      public double computeUnrealizedGainOrLoss()
      Get the gain or loss amount depending on current prices.
      Returns:
      A gain or loss amount

    • setPrice

      public void setPrice(double price)
      Update the price.
      Parameters:
      price - Updated market price of the investment.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If fund price is invalid

    • getSymbol

      public String getSymbol()
      Return the ticker symbol.
      Returns:
      Symbol
